meanings.definition: To cook (food) with hot seasoning or sauce.
meanings.sent1: She deviled the eggs by adding a spicy sauce.
meanings.sent2: The chef deviled the shrimp with a fiery seasoning.
meanings.sent3: The barbecue was deviled with a secret spicy rub.
meanings.sent4: The hot sauce deviled the chicken wings like a fiery dragon.
meanings.sent5: The sizzling skillet deviled the steak to perfection.

meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy deviled the cat by chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The constant ringing of the phone deviled her during work.
meanings.sent5: The teasing classmates deviled him with their jokes.

meanings.definition: To possess a devilish quality or nature.
meanings.sent1: His mischievous grin deviled his true intentions.
meanings.sent2: The old house seemed to be deviled by a ghostly presence.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten deviled the dog with its antics.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious stranger deviled the town with his enigmatic aura.
meanings.sent5: The eerie fog deviled the forest, creating an ominous atmosphere.
